questions.question_text: A company has users that frequently visit locations outside the office. These users need to be able to make calls and keep the company integrity by presenting a company caller ID. The users are equipped with company-paid mobile phones. The company uses Cisco UCM with Cisco Unified Border Element and Expressway-C and Expressway-E for external communications. Which technology must be configured to meet this requirement?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
Cisco Unified Mobility gives users the ability to redirect incoming IP calls from Cisco Unified Communications Manager to different designated phones, such as cellular phones. Users can also transition active calls between their Cisco desktop and mobile phone without interruption.

https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/products/unified-communications/unified-mobility/index.html

IS BADDDDDD Question 
My opinion MRA is the correct answer BC Expressway C & E and CUCM, CUBE exist in this environment .

But my ANSW: B

questions.question_text:
DRAG DROP
-

An organization configures a SIP trunk in Cisco UCM to connect to another system. These requirements must be met:

1. Use a specific IP address for SIP signaling.
2. Encrypt the signaling traffic.
3. Restrict which devices can use the SIP trunk.
4. Simplify SIP signaling.

Drag and drop the Cisco UCM configuration steps from the left onto the order on the right to achieve these goals.

//IMG//

discussion.content:
1 - Set the SIP trunk destination: (Addresses the IP address requirement for SIP signaling).
2 - Enable TLS: (Encrypts the signaling traffic).
3 - Assign a device pool: (Restricts the devices that can use the SIP trunk).
4 - Configure SIP Early Offer: (Simplifies SIP signaling).

1.Set the SIP trunk destination
2.Enable TLS
3.Assign a device pool
4.Configure SIP Early Offer

choices.B: There is SIP Delayed Offer. DTMF is supported only in Early Offer.
choices.C: The rtpmap:0 value for the negotiated codec is marking DTMF as inactive.
choices.A: The negotiated RTP port is outside of the range described by RFC, so inband DTMFs do not work.

discussion.content: Only (18) G.729/8000 ist negotiated (D is correct)

choices.D: in the VoIP or POTS dial peers

questions.question_text: Where is the dtmf-relay command configured on Cisco Unified Border Element?

choices.D: The pipe or link configuration for video is set to only one device.
choices.B: The zone settings for video are too low.
choices.C: The location setting for video is too low.
choices.A: The subzone setting for video is too low.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
In Cisco Unified Communications Manager (CUCM), location settings are used to manage bandwidth for audio and video calls. If the location's video bandwidth setting is too low, it can restrict the number of simultaneous video calls.
Since audio calls work fine and only one video call works at a time, it strongly suggests a bandwidth limitation for video traffic at the location level.
C. The location setting for video is too low.

questions.question_text: Users in a small location report that audio calls work fine, but only one video call works before the next one gets a busy signal. Three video conference rooms were recently installed by a third party. The audio and video devices are Cisco endpoints. The site uses video and audio calls, and a network investigation does not show saturation on the link. The site is configured with QoS and CoS. All devices are registered on the headquarters Cisco UCM cluster. What is the cause of this problem?
